    • Method Detail

      • computeRoute

        IRoute computeRoute(INode<T> node,
                    INode<T> node2)
        This method relies on the map data, and computes a route towards some absolute coordinate solving a TSP problem. It's up to the specific IAction calling this method to effectively move nodes along the path. It uses the fastest path as metric.
        Parameters:
        node - The start node
        node2 - the second node's position will be used as destination
        Returns:
        A IRoute object describing the path the node should follow

      • computeRoute

        IRoute computeRoute(IPosition p1,
                    IPosition p2,
                    Vehicle vehicle)
        This method relies on the map data, and computes a route towards some absolute coordinate solving a TSP problem. It's up to the specific IAction calling this method to effectively move nodes along the path.
        Parameters:
        p1 - start position
        p2 - end position The absolute coordinate where this node wants to move to
        vehicle - vehicle to use. Different vehicles may use different paths, e.g. pedestrians can't go along a highway, but can walk the parks
        Returns:
        A IRoute object describing the path the node should follow

      • computeRoute

        IRoute computeRoute(IPosition p1,
                    IPosition p2)
        This method relies on the map data, and computes a route towards some absolute coordinate solving a TSP problem. It's up to the specific IAction calling this method to effectively move nodes along the path.
        Parameters:
        p1 - start position
        p2 - end position The absolute coordinate where this node wants to move to
        Returns:
        A IRoute object describing the path the node should follow

      • computeRoute

        IRoute computeRoute(INode<T> node,
                    IPosition coord)
        This method relies on the map data, and computes a route towards some absolute coordinate solving a TSP problem. It's up to the specific IAction calling this method to effectively move nodes along the path.
        Parameters:
        node - The INode to move
        coord - The absolute coordinate where this node wants to move to
        Returns:
        A IRoute object describing the path the node should follow

      • computeRoute

        IRoute computeRoute(INode<T> node,
                    IPosition coord,
                    Vehicle vehicle)
        This method relies on the map data, and computes a route towards some absolute coordinate solving a TSP problem. It's up to the specific IAction calling this method to effectively move nodes along the path.
        Parameters:
        node - The INode to move
        coord - The absolute coordinate where this node wants to move to
        vehicle - The vehicle tipe for this route
        Returns:
        A IRoute object describing the path the node should follow

      • getNextPosition

        IPosition getNextPosition(INode<T> node,
                          ITime time)
        Works only if the node is associated with a IGPSTrace.
        Parameters:
        node - the INode
        time - the time
        Returns:
        the position immediately after time in the IGPSTrace

      • getPreviousPosition

        Parameters:

        time - the time
        Returns:
        the position immediately before time in the IGPSTrace

      • getExpectedPosition

        IPosition getExpectedPosition(INode<T> node,
                              ITime time)
        Works only if the node is associated with a IGPSTrace.
        Parameters:
        node - the INode
        time - the time
        Returns:
        interpolates the position immediately before and the one immediately after time in the IGPSTrace

      • getTrace

        IGPSTrace getTrace(INode<T> node)
        Works only if the node is associated with a IGPSTrace.
        Parameters:
        node - the INode
        Returns:
        the associated IGPSTrace
